data.description:
"Makes my brain feel like it's having its first cup of coffee in the morning!" 
- Adam Savage

Challenge your mind in Cubism, a deceptively simple puzzle game where you assemble increasingly complex shapes out of colorful blocks.

Immerse yourself in a zen environment as you reason your way through 90 puzzles which will put your spatial thinking skills to the test. 

Features:
- 90 challenging puzzles over two campaigns
- Full hand tracking support
- 120Hz support
- Light & Dark mode
- Passthrough mode

changelog.change_log: - fixed an issue where index and thumb would sometimes deform when switching to controllers and back to hand tracking

- support for MR loading screen on Quest 3
- replaced 'hand overlay' option in Mixed Reality settings with 'hand style', adding a style which removes hand outlines.
- improved readability of Settings and Puzzle Editor menus in MR
- show arrow symbol between hands when moving play area around while making fists
- fix issue where loading a corrupted save file isn't handled well
- fixed issue where puzzle pieces could be clipped through the floor and walls in MR

- Added experimental support for Quest’s Space Setup, allowing you to bring in your real walls and furniture into the game
- Added experimental puzzle persistence between sessions, where the game will try and load the last played puzzle at the last location you were playing on start
- Added a new recenter button that makes it easier to place the puzzle in front of you when you move around your room, and makes it easier to snap the puzzle to a table surface

Added a local puzzle-editor to allow you to design your own Cubism puzzles. (you can enable it in the settings)
Learn more about using the editor at: www.cubism-vr.com/editor

Support for Hands 2.0 improved hand tracking
- turned hand smoothing off by default
- adjusted the messaging in the hand tracking modal at the start of the game

Bugfixes
- fixed an issue where thrown pieces would appear to stutter
- fixed an issue where the play area could be spun around during repositioning when advanced controls had previously been turned on
- fixed an issue where pieces would fly towards your hands when pinching when advanced controls had previously been turned on

- fix issue where held piece could disappear when switching from hands to controllers
- fix issue where the incorrect localized title would load when restarting a game after switching languages
- fix issue where debug hand joints would be visible when using controllers

- the puzzle can now be snapped back onto the podium
- you can now also rotate the playarea when you reposition it 
- the game will fade out when the system menu is opened to help indicate that the game is paused

- Added “Passthrough Mode”, which lets you play Cubism in AR using Quest’s passthrough API
- Mod support for puzzle file format v2 (learn more at [github.com/](github.com/cubismvr/Mods)cubismvr/mods)
- The playarea can be repositioned all the way down to the floor, and the menu will automatically flatten itself out when done so. When calibrating the floor height to a table surface, this lets you play in 'tabletop mode'.
- Several performance improvements on the menu.
- Regression: shadows quality reduced in 120Hz mode to compensate for the potential lack of FFR support in OpenXR
New hand gesture shortcut: make a fists with both hands and move them to reposition the play area.

- Added 'Volume 2', a new campaign with 30 puzzles
- Layout changes to the main menu
- Switched to linear color space
- Improved position of 'Reposition Playarea' button higher up in the menu to be easier to reach

- Added ability to 'force pull' distant pieces with hand tracking 
- Added support for 60Hz hand tracking 
- Reduced .apk size from 110Mb to 75Mb 
- Fixed the color gamut to Rec_2020 for more consistent color between PC and Quest
- Fixed issue where 'continuous music mode' option would not work when replaying solved puzzles
Fixed an issue with localization where text wouldn't display correctly if a user's Quest was set to a language not supported by the game.

- added localization in English, French, Spanish, German, Japanese, Korean and Simplified Chinese.
- added custom title puzzles for Japanese, Korean and Simplified Chinese

- fixed an issue where only one song would play in continuous music mode
- fixed an issue where the game would lock up if the player variables save file was corrupted
- small performance improvements to the menu
